inputFields.name: eq
inputFields.description: Match strings that equal the provided value exactly.

inputFields.name: neq
inputFields.description: Match strings that don't equal the provided value.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

inputFields.name: eq
inputFields.description: Match strings that equal the provided value exactly.

inputFields.name: neq
inputFields.description: Match strings that don't equal the provided value.

inputFields.name: startsWith
inputFields.description: Match strings that start with the provided substring.

inputFields.name: eq
inputFields.description: Match strings that equal the provided value exactly.

inputFields.name: eqLower
inputFields.description: Match (case-insensitive) strings that equal the provided value exactly.

inputFields.name: neq
inputFields.description: Match strings that don't equal the provided value.

inputFields.name: neqLower
inputFields.description: Match (case-insensitive) strings that don't equal the provided value exactly.

inputFields.name: startsWith
inputFields.description: Match strings that start with the provided substring.

inputFields.name: startsWithLower
inputFields.description: Match (case-insensitive) strings that start with the provided substring

inputFields.name: eq
inputFields.description: Match numbers that equal the provided value.

inputFields.name: neq
inputFields.description: Match numbers that don't equal the provided value.

inputFields.name: gt
inputFields.description: Match numbers that are greater than the provided value.

inputFields.name: gte
inputFields.description: Match numbers that are equal to or greater than the provided value.

inputFields.name: lt
inputFields.description: Match numbers that are less than the provided value.

inputFields.name: lte
inputFields.description: Match numbers that are equal to or less than the provided value.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

inputFields.name: eq
inputFields.description: Match timestamps that equal the provided value.

inputFields.name: neq
inputFields.description: Match timestamps that don't equal the provided value.

inputFields.name: gt
inputFields.description: Match timestamps that are greater than the provided value.

inputFields.name: gte
inputFields.description: Match timestamps that are equal to or greater than the provided value.

inputFields.name: lt
inputFields.description: Match timestamps that are less than the provided value.

inputFields.name: lte
inputFields.description: Match timestamps that are equal to or less than the provided value.

inputFields.name: eq
inputFields.description: Match the provided boolean value.

inputFields.name: neq
inputFields.description: Match the opposite of the provided boolean value.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: PageInfo
types.description:
PageInfo from the Relay Cursor Connections Spec.
Note that the cursor fields are optional, and are null if no edges are returned.
See https://relay.dev/graphql/connections.htm#sec-undefined.PageInfo

fields.name: hasPreviousPage
fields.description: Whether more edges exist prior to the returned results.

fields.name: hasNextPage
fields.description: Whether more edges exist following the returned results.

fields.name: startCursor
fields.description: Corresponds to the first edge in the returned edges.

fields.name: endCursor
fields.description: Corresponds to the last edge in the returned edges.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: SortOrder
types.description: Standard pagination order indicator for paginatable fields.

types.name: Query
types.description: Query type.

fields.name: account
fields.description:
Get an account by its ID.

Currently, while accounts are still in beta, will only return your own account.
In the future, it will return public accounts.

fields.name: application
fields.description: Get an application by its ID.

fields.name: publicApplication
fields.description:
Get public information about an application for authorizing a user.

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_AUTHENTICATION` privilege.

fields.name: viewer
fields.description: Get metadata on the current access token.

fields.name: discordGuildInfo
fields.description:
Returns the stored discord guild info for a particular guild. Always returns
a value, with the required fields set to defaults if any settings weren't
set before.

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_DISCORD_GUILDS` privilege.

fields.name: discordUserInfo
fields.description:
Returns the stored discord user info for a particular discord user. Always
returns a value, with the required fields set to defaults if any settings
weren't set before.

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_DISCORD_GUILDS` privilege.

fields.name: page
fields.description:
Get a page by its canonical URL.

Note: Wikidot canonical URLs are always stored as "http://", regardless of
whether the individual Wikidot site supports or forces HTTPS.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 1 point.

fields.name: pages
fields.description:
Get a list of pages stored in Crom using a custom filter query. See the Relay
pagination spec (https://relay.dev/graphql/connections.htm) for documentation
on the before/after/first/last arguments and the connection/edge types.

The `filter` and `sort` arguments are specific to the Crom API. Use `filter`
to select the specific fields in the resulting node that must match a specific
value. The shape of the filter matches the shape of the page type. For example,
provide a value to `filter.attributions.user.displayName.eq` to get all pages
where `attributions.user.displayName` matches the provided string exactly.

Primitive types (strings, integers, enums) can be filtered using operators like
`eq` (equals), `neq` (not equals), `lt` (less than), etc. If multiple operators
are provided for a single field, they're combined using AND logic.

Filters for non-primitive types can be combined using boolean logic using `_and`,
`_or`, and `_not`. Multiple filters on a single object are implicitly combined
using `_and`, except fragment properties (e.g. `onWikidotPage`,
`onPageUrlReference`) which are combined using `_or`.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 1 point multiplied by the page size. The default page size is 100.

fields.name: aggregatePages
fields.description:
Get aggregate statistics for pages.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 2 points.

fields.name: matchingPages
fields.description:
Get a list of pages on related sites with matching paths. The provided URL
does not necessarily have to exist; it's just used to determine which pages
to fetch.

Used by the interwiki modules on many sites, so takes into account logic
like "wanderers" categories on certain branches and path truncation on
Wikidot pages, so it's more powerful than calling `page` for each site.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 20 points.

fields.name: randomPage_v1
fields.description:
Get a single random page that matches the filter. Returns null if no pages match.
Do not use - only supported for internal backwards compatibility.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 5 points.

fields.name: searchPages_v1
fields.description:
Do not use - only supported for internal backwards compatibility.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 1 point.

fields.name: readingList
fields.description:
Get a reading list by its ID or slug.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 1 point.

fields.name: sites
fields.description:
Returns a list of sites that Crom supports along with their metadata.

The API doesn't exactly function on a "site" abstraction, but this metadata
is useful for user-facing applications that typically separate concerns by
site.

fields.name: user
fields.description:
Get a user by their ID.

Providing an ID for a WikidotUserDisplayNameReference will always return a
UserWikidotNameReference regardless of whether the user exists.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 1 point.

fields.name: wikidotUser
fields.description:
Get a wikidot user by their displayName or wikidotId.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 1 point.

fields.name: searchUsers_v1
fields.description:
Do not use - only supported for internal backwards compatibility.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 1 point.

fields.name: usersByRank_v1
fields.description:
Do not use - only supported for internal backwards compatibility.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 2 points.

fields.name: wikidotPage
fields.description:
Get a wikidot page by its canonical URL or a best-case match for wikidot ID.

Note: Wikidot canonical URLs are always stored as "http://", regardless of
whether the individual Wikidot site supports or forces HTTPS.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 1 point.

types.name: Mutation
types.description: Mutation type.

fields.name: deleteAccountWikidotIntegration
fields.description:
Remove the currently logged in account's Wikidot integration.

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_ACCOUNT` scope.

fields.name: deleteAccountDiscordIntegration
fields.description:
Remove the currently logged in account's Discord integration.

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_ACCOUNT` scope.

fields.name: deleteAccountPatreonIntegration
fields.description:
Remove the currently logged in account's Patreon integration.

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_ACCOUNT` scope.

fields.name: deleteAccount
fields.description:
Delete the entire account.

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_ACCOUNT` scope.

fields.name: createApplication
fields.description:
Create a new application.

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_ACCOUNT` scope.

fields.name: updateApplication
fields.description:
Update an existing application.

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_ACCOUNT` scope.

fields.name: deleteApplication
fields.description:
Delete an application.

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_ACCOUNT` scope.

fields.name: createDiscordIntegration
fields.description:
Associate the current account with a new Discord account using an OAuth2
authorization code. Fails if the session isn't connected to an account.

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_AUTHENTICATION` privilege.

fields.name: createSessionWithDiscordIntegration
fields.description:
Logs in a user using a Discord OAuth2 authorization code. This fails if the
user is already logged in or if the Discord account isn't linked to a Crom
account previously.

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_AUTHENTICATION` privilege.

fields.name: sendMagicEmail
fields.description:
Sends a magic email containing an eight character code. This code can then
be used for other methods (like creating an account or changing an email
address).

This isn't rate limited on the GraphQL integration end, but is still rate
limited really hard using the email address and client IP fields.

Fails if the intent doesn't match the current session status (e.g. you're
trying to make a new account but you're already logged in).

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_AUTHENTICATION` privilege.

fields.name: verifyMagicEmail
fields.description:
Verify that the user received the magic email with the code. Marks the magic
code as no longer reusable and returns a new code, along with the status of
the email address being verified (whether to create a new account or just a
new session).

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_AUTHENTICATION` privilege.

fields.name: createSessionWithMagicEmail
fields.description:
Use the magic code to sign into an existing account. This will fail if the
email address isn't associated with an account. This ensures we don't
accidentally create accounts when users didn't expect it.

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_AUTHENTICATION` privilege.

fields.name: createAccountWithMagicEmail
fields.description:
Use the magic code to create a new account. Rather than returning the new
account (which you won't have the privileges to read as an anonymous user),
it returns the OAuth2 authorization code to get the access token for this
user.

This will just sign in the user if they already have an account associated
with the email address.

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_AUTHENTICATION` privilege.

fields.name: createPatreonIntegration
fields.description:
Associate the current account with a new Patreon account using an OAuth2
authorization code. Fails if the session isn't connected to an account.

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_AUTHENTICATION` privilege.

fields.name: createWikidotIntegration
fields.description:
Associate the current account with a wikidot account using an
"attestation page" code from https://verify.wikidot.com.

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_AUTHENTICATION` privilege.

fields.name: grantAuthorization
fields.description:
Grant authorization on behalf of the currently authorized user to a client
application.

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_AUTHENTICATION` privilege.

fields.name: updateDiscordGuildInfo
fields.description:
Update the DiscordGuildInfo for a particular discord guild.

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_DISCORD_GUILDS` privilege.

fields.name: updateDiscordGuildManagedRole
fields.description:
Update the DiscordGuildManagedRole for a particular discord role ID.

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_DISCORD_GUILDS` privilege.

fields.name: deleteDiscordGuildManagedRole
fields.description:
Delete the DiscordGuildManagedRole for a particular discord role ID.

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_DISCORD_GUILDS` privilege.

fields.name: updateDiscordUserInfo
fields.description:
Update a DiscordUserInfo for a tracked discord user.

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_DISCORD_GUILDS` privilege.

fields.name: insertPageAlternateTitles
fields.description:
Batch upsert API for PageAlternateTitles.

Uses the collection management system. Items belong to a collection
identified by a key (e.g. "scp-en"). Each time you insert data into
the collection, you insert it with a random ID. This lets you insert
a list of data using multiple smaller requests, but still diff against a
previous collection ID to delete items that no longer exist.

**Notice:** This field requires the `CRAWLER` privilege.

fields.name: deletePageAlternateTitles
fields.description:
Batch delete PageAlternateTitles using the collection management system.
Delete all items that match a collection key but don't match a collection
ID.

**Notice:** This field requires the `CRAWLER` privilege.

fields.name: insertPageAttributions
fields.description:
Batch upsert API for PageAttributions.

Uses the collection management system. Items belong to a collection
identified by a key (e.g. "scp-en"). Each time you insert data into
the collection, you insert it with a random ID. This lets you insert
a list of data using multiple smaller requests, but still diff against a
previous collection ID to delete items that no longer exist.

**Notice:** This field requires the `CRAWLER` privilege.

fields.name: deletePageAttributions
fields.description:
Batch delete PageAttributions using the collection management system.
Delete all items that match a collection key but don't match a collection
ID.

**Notice:** This field requires the `CRAWLER` privilege.

fields.name: createReadingList
fields.description:
Creates a new reading list.

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_READING_LISTS` scope.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 100 points.

fields.name: updateReadingList
fields.description:
Updates an existing reading list.

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_READING_LISTS` scope.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 10 points.

fields.name: deleteReadingList
fields.description:
Deletes an existing reading list.

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_READING_LISTS` scope.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 10 points.

fields.name: insertWikidotPage
fields.description:
Insert a WikidotPage with all its details by its canonical URL.

**Notice:** This field requires the `CRAWLER` privilege.

fields.name: updateWikidotPageMetadata
fields.description:
Partially update a WikidotPage without its content by its canonical URL.

**Notice:** This field requires the `CRAWLER` privilege.

fields.name: updateWikidotPageContent
fields.description:
Fully update a WikidotPage along with its content by its canonical URL.

**Notice:** This field requires the `CRAWLER` privilege.

fields.name: deleteWikidotPage
fields.description:
Delete WikidotPages by their page URL. If a page doesn't exist, it ignores the page.

**Notice:** This field requires the `CRAWLER` privilege.

fields.name: insertWikidotRevisions
fields.description:
Insert a list of wikidot revisions.

**Notice:** This field requires the `CRAWLER` privilege.

fields.name: insertWikidotVoteRecords
fields.description:
Insert a list of wikidot vote records. Fails if any of the inserted votes
occur before the latest state of the wiki.

**Notice:** This field requires the `CRAWLER` privilege.

types.name: URL
types.description: An absolute URL.

types.name: DateTime
types.description: An ISO8601-formatted DateTime string.

types.name: Account
types.description: Contains details about a single user account.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Account ID. Use this where a slug would be expected.

fields.name: emailAddress
fields.description:
The account's primary email address.

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_ACCOUNT` scope.

fields.name: applications
fields.description:
List all of the applications created by this account.

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_ACCOUNT` scope.

fields.name: discordIntegration
fields.description:
The linked discord account information.

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_ACCOUNT` scope.

fields.name: wikidotIntegration
fields.description:
The linked wikidot account information.

**Notice:** This field requires the `READ_WIKIDOT_INTEGRATION` scope.

fields.name: patreonIntegration
fields.description:
The linked patreon account information.

**Notice:** This field requires the `READ_PATREON_INTEGRATION` scope.

fields.name: defaultReadingList
fields.description:
A reading list that all entries go into by default.

One default reading list must exist for each user, but if it's marked as
private, it will return null when other users request it.

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_READING_LISTS` scope.

fields.name: readingLists
fields.description:
Get a filtered paginated list of reading lists created by this account.
If the account isn't the viewer, private lists won't be returned.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 1 point multiplied by the page size. The default page size is 10.

fields.name: displayName
fields.description: The correctly cased display name for the user.

fields.name: wikidotId
fields.description: A wikidot-specific user ID. Used for wikidot AJAX API stuff and profile image URL.

fields.name: unixName
fields.description:
The user's "unix name" is a slugified version of their wikidot username.
It is used primarily to generate their wikidot profile url.

fields.name: wikidotUser
fields.description:
The associated wikidot user object retrieved from the crawler data, if it
exists.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 1 point.

fields.name: discordId
fields.description: The discord account ID.

fields.name: username
fields.description: The discord username of the linked account.

fields.name: patreonId
fields.description: The Patreon account ID.

fields.name: isActive
fields.description: Whether the linked patreon account is an active patron of @crombird.

types.name: Application
types.description: An automated client that can authorize against and call the API.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The application ID.

fields.name: createdBy
fields.description: The account that created this application. May be null for internal apps.

fields.name: clientId
fields.description: The OAuth2 client ID.

fields.name: name
fields.description: User-visible name for this application.

fields.name: description
fields.description:
Description of this application. Used as justification for granting access,
and shown to users for code grants.

fields.name: aboutUrl
fields.description: Link to find out more about this application. Shown to users.

fields.name: redirectUris
fields.description:
A list of permitted redirect URIs for this application when used with the
code grant. Redirect URIs are matched using exact-string matching.

fields.name: privileges
fields.description:
The allowed special API privileges the client has access to. This is not
configurable and is meant for internal clients with special privileges.

types.name: PublicApplication
types.description:
Public information about an application viewable by users when authenticating
with this application.

fields.name: name
fields.description: User-visible name for this application.

fields.name: description
fields.description:
Description of this application. Used as justification for granting access,
and shown to users for code grants.

fields.name: aboutUrl
fields.description: Link to find out more about this application. Shown to users.

types.name: Viewer
types.description: The client accessing this API.

fields.name: scope
fields.description: The OAuth2 scope that the viewer has access to.

fields.name: application
fields.description: For OAuth2-authorized tokens, provides the current viewer application.

fields.name: account
fields.description: For user-authorized tokens, provides the account that authorized the client.

types.name: AuthTokenPair
types.description:
Access token and refresh token pair returned for internal auth endpoints.
Refresh token is always included since internal session creations are always
refreshable.

enumValues.name: CRAWLER
enumValues.description: Allows the crawler to update and delete publicly accessible wiki data.

enumValues.name: MANAGE_DISCORD_GUILDS
enumValues.description:
Allows access to discord guild config APIs (for all guilds).
Used by the discord bot to add/edit guild-specific preferences.

enumValues.name: MANAGE_AUTHENTICATION
enumValues.description:
Allows Crom's frontend website to authenticate users and make requests
on behalf of real end users.

enumValues.name: BYPASS_RATE_LIMITS
enumValues.description: Allows the client to break rate limiting requirements.

enumValues.name: MANAGE_ACCOUNT
enumValues.description: Allows the application to manage the user's account.

enumValues.name: READ_WIKIDOT_INTEGRATION
enumValues.description:
Allows the application to get details about the wikidot account linked to
the user's Crom account.

enumValues.name: READ_PATREON_INTEGRATION
enumValues.description:
Allows the application to get details about the patreon account linked to
the user's Crom account.

enumValues.name: MANAGE_READING_LISTS
enumValues.description:
Allows the application to create, update, and delete publicly viewable and
private reading lists.

types.name: DiscordGuildInfo
types.description:
Per-server config for the discord bot.

It's managed by the API and not the bot because it can open up future
server management options in the settings menu.

fields.name: guildId
fields.description: Discord guild snowflake ID.

fields.name: defaultSiteUrl
fields.description: The wiki configured to be the guild's default search domain.

fields.name: managedRoleMessageId
fields.description:
The Discord snowflake ID of the message listing the roles that can be
selected by users. Optional if a message wasn't created.

fields.name: managedRoles
fields.description: A list of all the roles that Crom can assign to users.

types.name: DiscordGuildManagedRole
types.description: Information about the managed role.

fields.name: roleId
fields.description: Discord role snowflake ID.

fields.name: config
fields.description: The wiki configured to be the guild's default search domain.

fields.name: disableAutoAssign
fields.description:
If true, the bot doesn't assign this role as part of the "assign all roles"
feature. This makes sense for truly optional roles, like vanity/color roles.

fields.name: wikiUrl
fields.description:
The origin URL (in HTTP) that the linked wikidot account should be a member
of (at the time of signup). The URL format isn't checked, but the discord
bot will only check if it's a wikidot.com subdomain.

fields.name: minPageCount
fields.description:
The minimum number of pages across the sites the author must have to qualify
for this role.

fields.name: siteUrls
fields.description:
The site(s) to check for the user's authorship on. Only current authorship
is checked.

fields.name: minRating
fields.description: Minimum rating across the authored pages for them to be counted.

fields.name: minAgeHours
fields.description: Minimum age of the page (in hours) to be counted.

fields.name: withTags
fields.description: The tags the page should have to be counted.

fields.name: excludeTags
fields.description: The tags the page should not have to be counted.

types.name: DiscordUserInfo
types.description:
Per-user config for the discord bot.

This is different to a AccountDiscordIntegration because it can be set by the
bot on a per-user level regardless of whether they have a Crom account.

fields.name: account
fields.description:
The Crom account linked to this discord user, if present.
This can be used to fetch other integrations, like a linked wikidot account.

fields.name: defaultSiteUrl
fields.description:
The base URL for the user's searches on discord across all guilds and
inside DMs.

types.name: PageAlternateTitle
types.description:
Tracks an alternate title.

Alternate titles are titles derived from outside the page itself. For example,
SCP titles come from a seprate listing page.

fields.name: source
fields.description: The canonical URL of the page where the alternate title was found.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title string.

fields.name: page
fields.description:
The page associated with the alternate title.
Currently always returns a PageUrlReference for legacy reasons.

types.name: PageAttribution
types.description:
A tracked attribution to the page.
Also enriched with platform history where possible.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of contribution.

fields.name: user
fields.description:
The contribution user. For wikidot pages, this data comes from a manually
curated table, and so will always be a UserWikidotNameReference. Use
`.wikidotUser` on the type if you want to get wikidot user details.

The provided user's display name may be incorrectly capitalized if the
data was manually provided.

fields.name: date
fields.description:
An optional date of contribution.
If a time is not present, it's rounded down to midnight.

fields.name: order
fields.description:
Relative order of the attribution in the attribution table. Only use this
to sort attributions to match the original table order (the absolute value
is meaningless).

types.name: PageAttributionType
types.description:
The type of attribution.
For more information, see https://scpwiki.com/attribution-metadata

enumValues.name: AUTHOR
enumValues.description: Primary author or co-authors of the page.

enumValues.name: REWRITE
enumValues.description: Authors of major rewrites to the page. A date is usually accompanied.

enumValues.name: TRANSLATOR
enumValues.description: Translators of pages originally written in another language.

enumValues.name: SUBMITTER
enumValues.description:
A fallback type pointing to the user who created this page if no explicit
attributions have been provided.

types.name: Page
types.description:
Represents a page on the internet.
Each URL is canonically tied to a single page.

fields.name: url
fields.description: The URL of the page. Remember, all wikidot URLs are stored as "http://".

fields.name: attributions
fields.description:
High-level information about the users attributed to the page.
Data comes from either page info or external attribution pages.

fields.name: alternateTitles
fields.description:
Alternate titles for SCP or Backrooms style pages. Data comes from external
listing pages on Wikidot.

types.name: PageUrlReference
types.description:
A reference to a wikidot page that may or may not exist.
Provided when resources manually refer to pages by URL and can get out of date.

fields.name: page
fields.description:
The referenced page, if present in the API.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 1 point.

fields.name: attributions
fields.description:
Proxy for page.attributions. Returns empty list if page is null.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 2 points.

fields.name: alternateTitles
fields.description:
Proxy for page.alternateTitles. Returns empty list if page is null.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 1 point.

types.name: ResolvedPage
types.description:
A Page object that is tracked in Crom's database.
Basically excludes URL reference types.

fields.name: attributions
fields.description: Proxy for page.attributions. Returns empty list if page is null.

fields.name: alternateTitles
fields.description: Proxy for page.alternateTitles. Returns empty list if page is null.

enumValues.name: WIKIDOT_FULLNAME
enumValues.description:
Warning: Don't use unless you know what you're doing.
Order by POSIX-collated approximation of wikidot's internal fullname representation.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this reading list.

fields.name: slug
fields.description:
A URL path friendly slug for the reading list. Typically the ID concatenated
with a truncated slugified version of the title.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of the reading list.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description. Would outline why the list was created and what it contains.

fields.name: isPublic
fields.description: Whether this reading list is publicly accessible.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The time when the list was created.

fields.name: createdBy
fields.description: The account that created the list.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: The time when the list was last updated.

fields.name: view
fields.description: The default view for all viewers of the list.

fields.name: items
fields.description: Items that make up the list, defined in visible order for the list view.

fields.name: tiers
fields.description:
Tiers for tier list view of the reading list. Defined in order from top to
bottom. If no tiers were defined yet, the property will be null.

fields.name: page
fields.description: The linked page.

fields.name: comment
fields.description: An optional comment attached to this reading list item.

fields.name: insertedAt
fields.description: When the item was first added to the list.

fields.name: tierId
fields.description:
The ID of the tier that this item belongs to. If null, it's placed outside
the tiers in the list view order.

fields.name: id
fields.description: An ID to identify the tier from the reading list items.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the tier (e.g. "S", "A", "B", etc.)

fields.name: color
fields.description: The hex color code for the tier.

fields.name: type
fields.description:
The type of wiki.

This information can be used to determine wiki-specific conventions or
generate interwiki URLs among wikis of the same type.

fields.name: displayName
fields.description:
An friendly English-language name for the site. Typically just the
type suffixed with the language.

fields.name: url
fields.description:
The base domain of the site.

All pages indexed from the site will start with this URL. Some wikis
(such as the -EN wiki) are still returned as "http://" URLs for historical
reasons.

fields.name: language
fields.description: The written language of the wiki as an IETF language tag.

fields.name: recentlyCreatedUrl
fields.description:
The URL for the site's "recently created" page.
This is used by the discord bot to link to when calling "lc" or "/latest".

types.name: SiteType
types.description: A family of wikis that the wiki belongs to.

types.name: User
types.description: A user of a platform.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
An opaque ID that uniquely identifies this user across all platforms.
For example, two accounts with the same username on different platforms will
have different IDs.

fields.name: displayName
fields.description:
The name to show when displaying this user. All users must have some
representable "friendly" name. It isn't necessarily unique.

Some examples of "special" display names are "Anonymous", "Unknown Author",
"Staff", and "(deleted user)".

fields.name: statistics
fields.description:
Aggregated user statistics, scoped to sites (see `sites` query for a list
of which sites are supported). Providing no value to `siteUrl` returns
statistics across all pages.

Important note: these statistics are not updated in real time.

fields.name: attributedPages
fields.description:
Connection returning the list of pages that the user is attributed to.

This is expensive because it essentially runs the `pages` query for each
user. A more rate-limiting friendly alternative, especially when requesting
many pages at once, is to call the top-level `pages` field directly in a
separate second request.

types.name: UserWikidotNameReference
types.description:
A reference to a wikidot user that may or may not be real.
Provided when users are manually referred to by their wikidot display name.

fields.name: id
fields.description: See `User.id`.

fields.name: displayName
fields.description:
The referenced name of this user. This user may be a real
account, a previously existing account, or neither (e.g. Anonymous, Unknown
Author, Staff). Or just a misspelled username.

fields.name: statistics
fields.description:
See `User.statistics`.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 1 point.

fields.name: userPage
fields.description:
Get the "author page" for the wikidot user on the given site.

Functionally equivalent to calling `attributedPages` with the filter
`{ url: { startsWith: $siteUrl }, onWikidotPage: { isUserPage: { eq: true } } }`,
and returning the earliest matching page, but with a much lower rate
limiting complexity.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 1 point.

fields.name: attributedPages
fields.description:
See `User.attributedPages`.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 5 points multiplied by the page size. The default page size is 100.

fields.name: wikidotUser
fields.description:
The referenced wikidot user, if their details are present in the API.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 1 point.

fields.name: linkedAccount
fields.description:
The Crom account linked to this wikidot account, if one is present.

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_DISCORD_GUILDS` privilege.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 1 point.

fields.name: id
fields.description: See `User.id`.

fields.name: displayName
fields.description: The wikidot display name for this user.

fields.name: statistics
fields.description:
See `User.statistics`.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 1 point.

fields.name: userPage
fields.description:
Get the "author page" for the wikidot user on the given site.

Functionally equivalent to calling `attributedPages` with the filter
`{ url: { startsWith: $siteUrl }, onWikidotPage: { isUserPage: { eq: true } } }`,
and returning the earliest matching page, but with a much lower rate
limiting complexity.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 1 point.

fields.name: attributedPages
fields.description:
See `User.attributedPages`.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 5 points multiplied by the page size. The default page size is 100.

fields.name: unixName
fields.description: The "slugified" version of the display name, for use in URLs and so on.

fields.name: wikidotId
fields.description:
The wikidot-specific ID for this user. Can be used to identify them across
renames.

fields.name: linkedAccount
fields.description:
The Crom account linked to this wikidot account, if one is present.

**Notice:** This field requires the `MANAGE_DISCORD_GUILDS` privilege.

fields.name: rank
fields.description: Rank amongst other users in this site.

fields.name: totalRating
fields.description:
Aggregate rating across all of the user's pages.
Excludes private pages.

fields.name: meanRating
fields.description:
Mean rating across the user's pages.
For self-esteem reasons, private pages are excluded.

fields.name: pageCount
fields.description: The number of pages attributed to the user. Excludes private pages.

fields.name: pageCountScp
fields.description: Number of pages by this author tagged "scp", or international variant.

fields.name: pageCountTale
fields.description: Number of pages by this author tagged "tale", or international variant.

fields.name: pageCountGoiFormat
fields.description:
Number of pages by this author tagged "goi-format", or international
variant.

fields.name: pageCountArtwork
fields.description: Number of pages by this author tagged "artwork", or international variant.

fields.name: pageCountLevel
fields.description: Number of pages by this author tagged "level", or international variant.

fields.name: pageCountEntity
fields.description: Number of pages by this author tagged "entity", or international variant.

fields.name: pageCountObject
fields.description: Number of pages by this author tagged "object", or international variant.

types.name: WikidotPage
types.description: Information specific to Wikidot pages.

fields.name: attributions
fields.description: **Rate limiting:** This field consumes 2 points.

fields.name: alternateTitles
fields.description: **Rate limiting:** This field consumes 1 point.

fields.name: wikidotId
fields.description: Last known wikidot's internal page ID for this page.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The page's title. An empty string is returned if a title doesn't exist.

fields.name: rating
fields.description: The page's rating, if the page/category supports voting.

fields.name: voteCount
fields.description: The total number of votes cast on this page.

fields.name: category
fields.description:
The wikidot category of this page. The default page category is "_default".
The category is also a part of the path (i.e. /category:page-slug).

fields.name: tags
fields.description: All tags set on the page.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The time when this page was created.

fields.name: revisionCount
fields.description:
The number of revisions made to the page.
The number is primarily used by the crawler to determine if a page was
updated since the last crawl.

fields.name: commentCount
fields.description:
The number of posts in the associated forum thread created for this page.
The link to the forum thread itself is not stored by Crom.

fields.name: isHidden
fields.description:
Whether this page is considered "hidden" on this wiki. Hidden pages should
not be displayed as being attributed to a user, or be considered for
aggregation. But they still exist on the wiki.

See https://github.com/crombird/selectors/blob/main/selectors/hidden-pages.json

fields.name: isUserPage
fields.description:
Whether this page is a user page on a wiki. Typically, they're referred
to as "author pages" on most sites, and are identified based on a
combination of tags (e.g. "author") and attribution.

See https://github.com/crombird/selectors/blob/main/selectors/author-pages.json

fields.name: createdBy
fields.description:
The user that posted this article.

Returns null if the account was deleted before the crawler got to it.
This only exists to provide low-level PageWikidotInfo specific data. Prefer
the generic attributions field on the page.

fields.name: thumbnailUrl
fields.description: The original URL to the uncropped thumbnail image for this page.

fields.name: parent
fields.description:
The parent page, if one is attached. Stored as a PageUrlReference because
the crawler only fetches the parent page URL when the child page is crawled.

This means that the parent page may have been renamed, moved, or deleted.

fields.name: children
fields.description:
Pages that have this page marked as the parent page.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 1 point.

fields.name: source
fields.description:
The wikidot page source for this page, if accessible.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 1 point.

fields.name: textContent
fields.description:
The raw unformatted text content of the page. It can often include hidden
text or code blocks, so it's not meant for display, only for indexing for
full-text search.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 1 point.

fields.name: revisions
fields.description:
Returns the metadata for all revisions on this page in index order.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 1 point multiplied by the page size. The default page size is 100.

fields.name: accountVoteRecords
fields.description:
Get all historical vote records for the page scoped to the logged-in user.
Unlike `fuzzyVoteRecords`, the timestamps are returned without any fuzzing.

If the session isn't associated with an account or if the account isn't
linked to a wikidot account, this will just return an empty connection.

**Notice:** This field requires the `READ_WIKIDOT_INTEGRATION` scope.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 1 point multiplied by the page size. The default page size is 100.

fields.name: fuzzyVoteRecords
fields.description:
Get coarse-grained vote records for the page from oldest to newest.

This returns a connection of vote records rounded down to the recorded day,
to prevent abuse. For multiple vote changes made by a user in a single day,
it will only return the latest tracked record. Data is returned in order of
vote date, but not necessarily in chronological order within each day.

Votes started being tracked in May 2022, so timestamps are clamped to around
that time. If you want data from before that, see https://scpper.com (note
that it does not support API access for vote data).

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 1 point multiplied by the page size. The default page size is 100.

fields.name: currentVoteRecords
fields.description:
Get precise vote records for the current state of the page. This skips all
the intermediate records, and only returns the latest vote by each user for
the page. Adding the direction values of all these records together should
give you the current vote count for the page.

This is only available to the crawler so that it can diff against the current
votes and only insert new changes.

**Notice:** This field requires the `CRAWLER` privilege.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: WikidotRevision
types.description:
Metadata for a page revision on a wikidot page.
The source text is not captured.

fields.name: index
fields.description:
The revision's index in the page's revision history. The first revision is 0
and is probably always a PAGE_CREATED.

Warning: Indexes are not necessarily unique! Due to race conditions on
wikidot's end, it's possible for two revisions to have the same index.

fields.name: wikidotId
fields.description:
The revision's wikidot-specific ID. Not used for much, but is guaranteed to
be unique across all revisions on all pages across wikidot.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: The time the revision was made, according to wikidot.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The revision's type. May be null if wikidot doesn't provide it either.

fields.name: userWikidotId
fields.description:
The user's wikidot ID. Null if the edit was anonymous, in which case the
IP address associated with the edit is NOT recorded.

fields.name: comment
fields.description: Comment associated with the revision. Null if the comment is blank.

fields.name: user
fields.description:
The associated user based on the user's wikidot ID.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 1 point.

fields.name: page
fields.description:
The wikidot page associated with this vote record.

**Rate limiting:** This field consumes 1 point.

enumValues.name: PAGE_CREATED
enumValues.description: The first revision of a page. Flagged as type "N".

enumValues.name: SOURCE_CHANGED
enumValues.description: When the source of the page is changed. Flagged as type "S".

enumValues.name: FILES_CHANGED
enumValues.description: When a file attachment on the page is added or removed. Flagged as type "F".

enumValues.name: TAGS_CHANGED
enumValues.description: When tags are changed. Flagged as type "A".

enumValues.name: TITLE_CHANGED
enumValues.description: When the title of the page is changed. Flagged as type "T".

inputFields.name: type
inputFields.description: Optional because old revisions don't have a type.

inputFields.name: userWikidotId
inputFields.description: Optional because revisions can be attributed to anonymous users or IP addresses.

inputFields.name: comment
inputFields.description: Optional because comments can be blank.

types.name: WikidotVoteRecord
types.description: A record of a change in a user's vote on a wikidot page.

fields.name: userWikidotId
fields.description: The associated wikidot user account ID. This is always present.

fields.name: page
fields.description: The wikidot page associated with this vote record.

fields.name: user
fields.description:
The associated wikidot user account. If the account was deleted, this
returns null.

fields.name: direction
fields.description:
The change in their vote. <0 = downvote, 0 = novote, >0 = upvote.

The numbers can be outside the specified range if wikidot registers the
user's vote twice (or more).

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description:
The time when the change was detected. This is not necessarily when the
vote was made, only when the crawler saw it.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.
